New Records: Arshdeep Singh became India's fifth-most prolific T20I wicket-taker with 86 scalps
Mayank Yadav made his debut with a maiden over
Varun Chakravarthy returned to the India XI after three years without ring rust
Key Match Events: Arshdeep Singh and Varun Chakravarthy struck early to dismantle Bangladesh's batting
India won by 7 wickets with 49 balls remaining
Pre-Game Insights: The match was the first at the new Gwalior stadium
India fielded a young and inexperienced side with only three retained players from the 2023 T20 World Cup winning squad
Post-Match Reflections: The Indian bowlers showed their dominance with a mix of pace and spin
Debutants Mayank Yadav and Nitish Kumar Reddy made significant contributions
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the first of the three-T20I series
Bangladesh's batting order collapsed under pressure from the Indian attack
The low target of 128 was achieved by India with ease
Others: Sidharth Monga is the senior writer at ESPNcricinfo who covered the match report
